Articles.Content:
Once upon a time I was doing two science contracts which involved testing something on the ground. I stuck a .65 meter engine on a 1.25 meter decoupler and plopped a stayputnik on top. I forgot to lower the decoupler force and the thing shot up into the air. I was kind of disappointed I wouldn't get my 600 kerbits back, but it landed on the decoupler thing and survived.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
(how2album?)

Does anyone else want to try this and completely abuse it

Edited October 29, 2015 by Legendary Emu

I think it was scott manley or someone else. But they created a HUGE version of this and launched something crazy fast. I doubt it would work now due to changes or just the instant heat.

Always interesting haha.

(how2album?)

take this part of the album link: 7sGDO

And place it between this without the spaces:

[ i m g u r ] [ / I m g u r ]
It was definitely Scott Manley or someone else, of that I can assure you. ;P
